Articles.Content: Jeb, Bill and Bob are onboard the only station I've made in v0.22, orbiting 500 km above sea level. I got sick and tired of the game constantly shoving them into my crafts instead of other Kerbals so now they're up there, retired.

Jeb is sitting alone on Duna after he underestimated on how much fuel you need for landing stage. Good news is that explosion of the return stage softened the impact and Command Pod touched the ground un-damaged, bad news is that Command Pod is only equipped with a parachute and thermometer, neither which help getting back to Kerbin. Rescue mission is already on the way, Bill is coming to get his buddy with additional seat bolted on the side of Command Pod Mk1.

Mine is on the mun unraveling the secrets of the universe with Bill

they got the company of Multivac, an AGI core below then.
Occupying center-seat on my first Career Mode mission to Duna ... Notice the delight on his face.
Orbiting Vall
Jeb is conducting a long term survey of the Duna polar region in his sleek Mk-3B Rover. He missed the multiple memos that we didn't yet possess the technology to get him home.
My Jeb just died from a disastrous parachute failure

My jeb is sitting in LKO in a fake Eve Lander; they sent him up there to get him out of the way and are still telling him the transfer window is weeks away. (They considered sending him anyway, but realized they'd forgotten to install an antenna.)

Bill, in the meantime, is currently 18 days away from Eve's SOI and will be landing on Gilly and will detach an unmanned probe to land on Eve. He ain't no fool.

My Jeb found out that it would be a good idea to reenact the scene from the old film "Mission to Duna" where the one dude is stranded for ages, waiting for a rescue op.

He's happy there, in his makeshift base, slowly wasting away for science...
In the astronaut complex, waiting for my massive duna ship to be fully assembled.

Lazing around on god damn Kerbin! I'm planting a flag on Ike, writing "Jebediah wuz here" before I realize it's actually stupid Bill! Seems I forgot to recover Jeb from the last mission. And by forgot to recover, I mean he's a lazy jerk.

My Jeb?

Currently stationed on a small two container base almost directly below the artifact there, along with Bob and Bill.

They also somehow wrecked the transfer ship that was supposed to bring them home-I'll fling a supply ship their way some time soon.

My Jeb is on a rescue vessel... being rescued.

I stranded him on Moho with Bill after I used way more fuel than anticipated. I landed them safely but there was no way I could get them back to orbit.

So I sent a rescue vessel that landed about 2km away from their lander, made them walk/EVA to the new ship and waited for a transfer window for Kerbin to take off again. But it appears I'm about 500m/s short of delta/v now...

So now I'm trying to figure out if I'd rather send them fuel or try to get them to Eve to be picked up by another ship.
He's just been rescued from the Mun after using up far to much fuel finding somewhere suitable to land in the East Crater.
My Jeb is on my Duna Base, he occasionally drives his 2nd rover, he broke the first one!

After ending in a highly weird moon encounter, he was slingshotted around the mun towards an aerobrake with kerbin. Due to the unfortunate placement of a mountain range, he was spread across kerbin at significant orbital velocities. It's how he'd have liked to go.

Jeb is sitting alone on Duna after he underestimated on how much fuel you need for landing stage. Good news is that explosion of the return stage softened the impact and Command Pod touched the ground un-damaged, bad news is that Command Pod is only equipped with a parachute and thermometer, neither which help getting back to Kerbin. Rescue mission is already on the way, Bill is coming to get his buddy with additional seat bolted on the side of Command Pod Mk1.

Follow-up: Bill crashed the first rescue craft when he tried to test this cool concept called "aerobraking" and got it horribly wrong, but fortunately Bob was up to the task and after re-building the rocket, he managed to land within 400m of Jeb's crash-site. After a short jog, Jeb is happily on-board and the pair is currently orbiting Duna, only 99 days until they can start the return trip back to Kerbin and we'll be able to get some good data on space-suit durability during the atmospheric re-entry.

Jeb is in orbit around the Mun. I don't mean in a spaceship. I mean just him, in orbit around the Mun. Turned out the ship he landed in didn't have quite enough fuel to make it back to orbit. But it was really close, so he hopped out and used his suit's RCS to get himself into orbit. Typical Jeb.

He's been there for a couple of years game time due to several interplanetary missions undertaken since he got there. Seems fine. Someday he'll get rescued.

In a hitchhiker with Bill and Bob, on top of the VAB. But don't worry, he'll be mission commander for my next (and first manned) Duna expedition, along with Chad, Dean, and Jonfel (My back-from-the-dead test pilot!).
My Jeb, along with Bill and Bob is in orbit around Eve currently, being in command of Project Caldari, my fist manned mission there with a total crew of 7.

Jeb is fuming back on Kerbin after a long time on the Mun. He's mad at Tomfurt Kerman for taking his 'most science earned in one mission' medal (Tomfurt did most of the work in my initial voyage to Jool).
He is currently managing operations on Valhalla, the space station orbiting around Kerbin. He is currently slated to join Bill and Bob on the first interplanetary mission.

He has so far:

-Completed the Space Program's first flight

-Gotten himself stranded in an inclined orbit around Kerbin (Thankfully almost circular)

-Received the Space Program's first rescue mission as a present (It must be his birthday!)

-Immediately received orders to get back in the pod for the first Solar mission

-Came back from Solar orbit a year (How long is a Kerbin year?) later.

-Immediately got back in the pod, but this time a three-man one with Bill and Bob.

IIRC he is still in LKO testing a CSM which is destined eventually for the Mun. Too lazy to check right now
My career Jeb is stuck orbiting Laythe... ran out of fuel for a return or a landing on Laythe lol
He's dead, I killed him so he wouldn't show up every flight.
